channel.title: CVE Feed for Ping Identity -- PingOne MFA Integration Kit for PingFederate
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Ping Identity -- PingOne MFA Integration Kit for PingFederate

item.title: CVE-2023-40356|2024-08-02T18:31:53.903Z -- ping%20identity -- pingone%20mfa%20integration%20kit%20for%20pingfederate
item.description: PingOne MFA Integration Kit contains a vulnerability related to the Prompt Users to Set Up MFA configuration. Under certain conditions, this configuration could allow for a new MFA device to be paired with a target user account without requiring second-factor authentication from the target’s existing registered devices. A threat actor might be able to exploit this vulnerability to register their own MFA device with a target user’s account if they have existing knowledge of the target user’s first factor credential.

item.title: CVE-2023-40702|2024-08-02T18:38:51.083Z -- ping%20identity -- pingone%20mfa%20integration%20kit%20for%20pingfederate
item.description: PingOne MFA Integration Kit contains a vulnerability where the skipMFA action can be configured such that user authentication does not require the second factor authentication from the user's existing registered devices. A threat actor might be able to exploit this vulnerability to authenticate as a target user if they have existing knowledge of the target user’s first-factor credentials.
